title: Carlos Villarías
data: Carlos Villarías (7 July 1892 – 27 April 1976) was a Spanish actor who was born in Córdoba, Spain, and died in California, United States. His most famous role is in the title role of the  Spanish-language version of Dracula (1931), with Barry Norton and Lupita Tovar, filmed at night on the same sets as the English-language version starring Bela Lugosi. This article about a film actor is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
